moves.2. Nf3: Possibly could play the Open Variation.
moves.4. Nxd4: He could have played Qxd4 and possibly turn into the Maroczy Bind!
moves.4... Nf6: Attacking his e4 pawn. Duh, what else?
moves.6. f3: I believe this is the English?
moves.6... e6: Possibly turning into the Scheveningen Variation
moves.7. Be3: English. A very deadly attack against the Najdorf. I usually lose against it :(
moves.8. Qd2: Standard plan: Castle long (0-0-0) and attack my king :(
moves.8... Qc7: Bringing my queen to a central square.
moves.9. O-O-O: Now, I think, he'll attack on the kingside.
moves.9... b5: I must attack on the queenside.
moves.10... Bb7: Bringing my DSB to a good square.
moves.11... Nfd7: Best place for my knight. Now I can bring to the queenside.
moves.12... Nb6: Better then going to Nc5. With Nb6, I can hop into a nice place on c4.
moves.13... Nc6: Getting my other knight out to the game.
moves.14. Qg2: Getting his queen ready for the kill: my king :(
moves.15. Nb1: Hee hee! I made him retreat :D
moves.15... Rc8: I could have castled long (0-0-0) but I want to leave my king in the centre.
moves.17. c3: ?! I really don't know why he did this? do you?
moves.20... Kxf7: ! My king my not be able to castle, but it's safe, for the moment.
moves.21. f4: Now it's his turn to attack.
moves.23. Rxc3: I think I lost some of my steam :(
moves.23... Bf6: ! Guarding my g7-pawn AND attacking his knight.
moves.24. Bg1: ! I was going to go Nxe3 and if Rexe3 Bxd4 winning.
moves.26. Qg4: My darn e-pawn is being attacked!
moves.27... Rec7: ! But pushing the f-pawn it blocks his queen so I can move my rook back.
moves.28... Ne5: ! Attacking his Queen. And opening the c-file.
moves.30... Qc4: ! Now I threaten Qxe2 and he can't take cause of the pin on the c-file.
moves.31... Nd3+: Check! And just about to win!
moves.32. Kb1: ? If I was white, I'd have ran for it via Kd2.
moves.33. bxc3: ? Blunder! I now have a forced mate, do you see it?
moves.34... Qxc3+: Check and opening up the c-file for my rook.
moves.35... Nb4+: Check! Mate is on its way!
moves.36... Bxe4+: ! Check and if Qxe4 Qc1 mate!
moves.37... Qc1#: MATE! I hope that you enjoyed the game? Please comment and rate it on the star system, thanks!
